definition: walking corpse (idiom)/zombie/person who lives only on the material level

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130

sentences.english: When Donald Trump watches The Walking Dead, he thinks of us.
sentences.chinese: 川普看美剧《行尸走肉》的时候会想到我们。

sentences.english: But I look like the good-for-nothing to be ordinary, at home shakes, keeps silent.
sentences.chinese: 而我则像行尸走肉一般，在家里晃悠，不言不语。

sentences.english: Many investors are walking around like zombies.
sentences.chinese: 很多投资者像行尸走肉一般没头脑。

sentences.english: I am now tired look like a good-for-nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我现在累得像一具行尸走肉。

sentences.english: No wonder now zombies are synonymous with being Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 无怪乎“行尸走肉”成了中国人的定义同义语。

sentences.english: We have so many people walking around who are dead an d don't even know it.
sentences.chinese: 在我们周围有那么多行尸走肉般的人，他们却不自知。

sentences.english: The unspeakable truth is that we should not try and outlive our usefulness.
sentences.chinese: 这个可怕的事实是我们不应该试图如行尸走肉般存在。

sentences.english: Being a mindless zombie can make you more likely to take things for granted.
sentences.chinese: 像一个没头脑的行尸走肉一样让你更容易忽略事情。

sentences.english: The Walking Dead comic and TV show have been a success.
sentences.chinese: 《行尸走肉》的漫画和电视秀一直办的很成功。

sentences.english: You don't have a dream, you lifeless creatures.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至都没有梦想，你这个行尸走肉。

sentences.english: Ultimately, you feel like you are wandering through life without purpose.
sentences.chinese: 最后，你觉得自己如行尸走肉一般生活毫无目标。

sentences.english: Welcome back to the second season of The Walking Dead.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎大家回到《行尸走肉》第二季。

sentences.english: Lao Tze, world a, smelly Taoist priest, putrefied walking corpse, smelly.
sentences.chinese: 老子，天下第一，臭道士，腐烂的行尸走肉，臭。

sentences.english: Ultimately, you feel like you’re wandering through life without purpose.
sentences.chinese: 最后，你觉得自己犹如行尸走肉，失去生活目标。

sentences.english: So this city is as eye-catching fashion walking corpses as puppets.
sentences.chinese: 于是这座城市里触目便是行尸走肉般的时尚傀儡。

definition: to lose all interest in life (idiom)
dead person/(coll.) to die/(of a death) to happen
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
to degrade/to degenerate/to become depraved/corrupt/a fall from grace
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
